div.bibl: The Reform Advocate, wk. of November 3, 1917, Vol. 54, p.305.

body.p: The Jewish Literary Society of Zion Temple has undertaken the first serious attempt to bring to the public a program of distinctive Jewish music, founded upon traditional Hebrew melodies by the musician, composer and lieder-singer, Solomon Golub.
The recital will take place November 17, at Zion Temple. Mr. Golub's work has received high praise from recognized musical authorities.
The program will consist largely of Mr. Golub's own compositions.
